72const int kScreencastDefaultFps = 5;
73
74template <class T>
75static std::string ToStringIfSet(const char* key,
76 const absl::optional<T>& val) {
77 std::string str;
78 if (val) {
79 str = key;
80 str += ": ";
81 str += val ? rtc::ToString(*val) : "";
82 str += ", ";
83 }
84 return str;
85}
86
87template <class T>
88static std::string VectorToString(const std::vector<T>& vals) {
89 rtc::StringBuilder ost; // no-presubmit-check TODO(webrtc:8982)
90 ost << "[";
91 for (size_t i = 0; i < vals.size(); ++i) {
92 if (i > 0) {
93 ost << ", ";
94 }
95 ost << vals[i].ToString();
96 }
97 ost << "]";
98 return ost.Release();
99}
100
101// Options that can be applied to a VideoMediaChannel or a VideoMediaEngine.
102// Used to be flags, but that makes it hard to selectively apply options.
103// We are moving all of the setting of options to structs like this,
104// but some things currently still use flags.
105struct VideoOptions {
106 VideoOptions();
107 ~VideoOptions();
108
109 void SetAll(const VideoOptions& change) {
110 SetFrom(&video_noise_reduction, change.video_noise_reduction);
111 SetFrom(&screencast_min_bitrate_kbps, change.screencast_min_bitrate_kbps);
112 SetFrom(&is_screencast, change.is_screencast);
113 }
114
115 bool operator==(const VideoOptions& o) const {
116 return video_noise_reduction == o.video_noise_reduction &&
117 screencast_min_bitrate_kbps == o.screencast_min_bitrate_kbps &&
118 is_screencast == o.is_screencast;
119 }
120 bool operator!=(const VideoOptions& o) const { return !(*this == o); }
121
122 std::string ToString() const {
123 rtc::StringBuilder ost;
124 ost << "VideoOptions {";
125 ost << ToStringIfSet("noise reduction", video_noise_reduction);
126 ost << ToStringIfSet("screencast min bitrate kbps",
127 screencast_min_bitrate_kbps);
128 ost << ToStringIfSet("is_screencast ", is_screencast);
129 ost << "}";
130 return ost.Release();
131 }
132
133 // Enable denoising? This flag comes from the getUserMedia
134 // constraint 'googNoiseReduction', and WebRtcVideoEngine passes it
135 // on to the codec options. Disabled by default.
136 absl::optional<bool> video_noise_reduction;
137 // Force screencast to use a minimum bitrate. This flag comes from
138 // the PeerConnection constraint 'googScreencastMinBitrate'. It is
139 // copied to the encoder config by WebRtcVideoChannel.
140 absl::optional<int> screencast_min_bitrate_kbps;
141 // Set by screencast sources. Implies selection of encoding settings
142 // suitable for screencast. Most likely not the right way to do
143 // things, e.g., screencast of a text document and screencast of a
144 // youtube video have different needs.
145 absl::optional<bool> is_screencast;
146 webrtc::VideoTrackInterface::ContentHint content_hint;
147
148 private:
149 template <typename T>
150 static void SetFrom(absl::optional<T>* s, const absl::optional<T>& o) {
151 if (o) {
152 *s = o;
153 }
154 }
155};
156
157class MediaChannel {
158 public:
159 class NetworkInterface {
160 public:
161 enum SocketType { ST_RTP, ST_RTCP };
162 virtual bool SendPacket(rtc::CopyOnWriteBuffer* packet,
163 const rtc::PacketOptions& options) = 0;
164 virtual bool SendRtcp(rtc::CopyOnWriteBuffer* packet,
165 const rtc::PacketOptions& options) = 0;
166 virtual int SetOption(SocketType type,
167 rtc::Socket::Option opt,
168 int option) = 0;
169 virtual ~NetworkInterface() {}
170 };
171
172 MediaChannel(const MediaConfig& config,
173 webrtc::TaskQueueBase* network_thread);
174 explicit MediaChannel(webrtc::TaskQueueBase* network_thread);
175 virtual ~MediaChannel();
176
177 virtual cricket::MediaType media_type() const = 0;
178
179 // Sets the abstract interface class for sending RTP/RTCP data.
180 virtual void SetInterface(NetworkInterface* iface);
181 // Called on the network when an RTP packet is received.
182 virtual void OnPacketReceived(rtc::CopyOnWriteBuffer packet,
183 int64_t packet_time_us) = 0;
184 // Called on the network thread after a transport has finished sending a
185 // packet.
186 virtual void OnPacketSent(const rtc::SentPacket& sent_packet) = 0;
187 // Called when the socket's ability to send has changed.
188 virtual void OnReadyToSend(bool ready) = 0;
189 // Called when the network route used for sending packets changed.
190 virtual void OnNetworkRouteChanged(
191 const std::string& transport_name,
192 const rtc::NetworkRoute& network_route) = 0;
193 // Creates a new outgoing media stream with SSRCs and CNAME as described
194 // by sp.
195 virtual bool AddSendStream(const StreamParams& sp) = 0;
196 // Removes an outgoing media stream.
197 // SSRC must be the first SSRC of the media stream if the stream uses
198 // multiple SSRCs. In the case of an ssrc of 0, the possibly cached
199 // StreamParams is removed.
200 virtual bool RemoveSendStream(uint32_t ssrc) = 0;
201 // Creates a new incoming media stream with SSRCs, CNAME as described
202 // by sp. In the case of a sp without SSRCs, the unsignaled sp is cached
203 // to be used later for unsignaled streams received.
204 virtual bool AddRecvStream(const StreamParams& sp) = 0;
205 // Removes an incoming media stream.
206 // ssrc must be the first SSRC of the media stream if the stream uses
207 // multiple SSRCs.
208 virtual bool RemoveRecvStream(uint32_t ssrc) = 0;
209 // Resets any cached StreamParams for an unsignaled RecvStream, and removes
210 // any existing unsignaled streams.
211 virtual void ResetUnsignaledRecvStream() = 0;
212 // Informs the media channel when the transport's demuxer criteria is updated.
213 // * OnDemuxerCriteriaUpdatePending() happens on the same thread that the
214 // channel's streams are added and removed (worker thread).
215 // * OnDemuxerCriteriaUpdateComplete() happens on the thread where the demuxer
216 // lives (network thread).
217 // Because the demuxer is updated asynchronously, there is a window of time
218 // where packets are arriving to the channel for streams that have already
219 // been removed on the worker thread. It is important NOT to treat these as
220 // new unsignalled ssrcs.
221 virtual void OnDemuxerCriteriaUpdatePending() = 0;
222 virtual void OnDemuxerCriteriaUpdateComplete() = 0;
223 // Returns the absoulte sendtime extension id value from media channel.
224 virtual int GetRtpSendTimeExtnId() const;
225 // Set the frame encryptor to use on all outgoing frames. This is optional.
226 // This pointers lifetime is managed by the set of RtpSender it is attached
227 // to.
228 // TODO(benwright) make pure virtual once internal supports it.
229 virtual void SetFrameEncryptor(
230 uint32_t ssrc,
231 rtc::scoped_refptr<webrtc::FrameEncryptorInterface> frame_encryptor);
232 // Set the frame decryptor to use on all incoming frames. This is optional.
233 // This pointers lifetimes is managed by the set of RtpReceivers it is
234 // attached to.
235 // TODO(benwright) make pure virtual once internal supports it.
236 virtual void SetFrameDecryptor(
237 uint32_t ssrc,
238 rtc::scoped_refptr<webrtc::FrameDecryptorInterface> frame_decryptor);
239
240 // Enable network condition based codec switching.
241 virtual void SetVideoCodecSwitchingEnabled(bool enabled);
242
243 // Base method to send packet using NetworkInterface.
244 bool SendPacket(rtc::CopyOnWriteBuffer* packet,
245 const rtc::PacketOptions& options);
246
247 bool SendRtcp(rtc::CopyOnWriteBuffer* packet,
248 const rtc::PacketOptions& options);
249
250 int SetOption(NetworkInterface::SocketType type,
251 rtc::Socket::Option opt,
252 int option);
253
254 // Corresponds to the SDP attribute extmap-allow-mixed, see RFC8285.
255 // Set to true if it's allowed to mix one- and two-byte RTP header extensions
256 // in the same stream. The setter and getter must only be called from
257 // worker_thread.
258 void SetExtmapAllowMixed(bool extmap_allow_mixed);
259 bool ExtmapAllowMixed() const;
260
261 virtual webrtc::RtpParameters GetRtpSendParameters(uint32_t ssrc) const = 0;
262 virtual webrtc::RTCError SetRtpSendParameters(
263 uint32_t ssrc,
264 const webrtc::RtpParameters& parameters) = 0;
265
266 virtual void SetEncoderToPacketizerFrameTransformer(
267 uint32_t ssrc,
268 rtc::scoped_refptr<webrtc::FrameTransformerInterface> frame_transformer);
269 virtual void SetDepacketizerToDecoderFrameTransformer(
270 uint32_t ssrc,
271 rtc::scoped_refptr<webrtc::FrameTransformerInterface> frame_transformer);
272
273 protected:
274 int SetOptionLocked(NetworkInterface::SocketType type,
275 rtc::Socket::Option opt,
276 int option) RTC_RUN_ON(network_thread_);
277
278 bool DscpEnabled() const;
279
280 // This is the DSCP value used for both RTP and RTCP channels if DSCP is
281 // enabled. It can be changed at any time via |SetPreferredDscp|.
282 rtc::DiffServCodePoint PreferredDscp() const;
283 void SetPreferredDscp(rtc::DiffServCodePoint new_dscp);
284
285 rtc::scoped_refptr<webrtc::PendingTaskSafetyFlag> network_safety();
286
287 // Utility implementation for derived classes (video/voice) that applies
288 // the packet options and passes the data onwards to `SendPacket`.
289 void SendRtp(const uint8_t* data,
290 size_t len,
291 const webrtc::PacketOptions& options);
292
293 void SendRtcp(const uint8_t* data, size_t len);
294
295 private:
296 // Apply the preferred DSCP setting to the underlying network interface RTP
297 // and RTCP channels. If DSCP is disabled, then apply the default DSCP value.
298 void UpdateDscp() RTC_RUN_ON(network_thread_);
299
300 bool DoSendPacket(rtc::CopyOnWriteBuffer* packet,
301 bool rtcp,
302 const rtc::PacketOptions& options);
303
304 const bool enable_dscp_;
305 const rtc::scoped_refptr<webrtc::PendingTaskSafetyFlag> network_safety_
306 RTC_PT_GUARDED_BY(network_thread_);
307 webrtc::TaskQueueBase* const network_thread_;
308 NetworkInterface* network_interface_ RTC_GUARDED_BY(network_thread_) =
309 nullptr;
310 rtc::DiffServCodePoint preferred_dscp_ RTC_GUARDED_BY(network_thread_) =
311 rtc::DSCP_DEFAULT;
312 bool extmap_allow_mixed_ = false;
313};
314
315// The stats information is structured as follows:
316// Media are represented by either MediaSenderInfo or MediaReceiverInfo.
317// Media contains a vector of SSRC infos that are exclusively used by this
318// media. (SSRCs shared between media streams can't be represented.)
319
320// Information about an SSRC.
321// This data may be locally recorded, or received in an RTCP SR or RR.
322struct SsrcSenderInfo {
323 uint32_t ssrc = 0;
324 double timestamp = 0.0; // NTP timestamp, represented as seconds since epoch.
325};
326
327struct SsrcReceiverInfo {
328 uint32_t ssrc = 0;
329 double timestamp = 0.0;
330};
331
332struct MediaSenderInfo {
333 MediaSenderInfo();
334 ~MediaSenderInfo();
335 void add_ssrc(const SsrcSenderInfo& stat) { local_stats.push_back(stat); }
336 // Temporary utility function for call sites that only provide SSRC.
337 // As more info is added into SsrcSenderInfo, this function should go away.
338 void add_ssrc(uint32_t ssrc) {
339 SsrcSenderInfo stat;
340 stat.ssrc = ssrc;
341 add_ssrc(stat);
342 }
343 // Utility accessor for clients that are only interested in ssrc numbers.
344 std::vector<uint32_t> ssrcs() const {
345 std::vector<uint32_t> retval;
346 for (std::vector<SsrcSenderInfo>::const_iterator it = local_stats.begin();
347 it != local_stats.end(); ++it) {
348 retval.push_back(it->ssrc);
349 }
350 return retval;
351 }
352 // Returns true if the media has been connected.
353 bool connected() const { return local_stats.size() > 0; }
354 // Utility accessor for clients that make the assumption only one ssrc
355 // exists per media.
356 // This will eventually go away.
357 // Call sites that compare this to zero should use connected() instead.
358 // https://bugs.webrtc.org/8694
359 uint32_t ssrc() const {
360 if (connected()) {
361 return local_stats[0].ssrc;
362 } else {
363 return 0;
364 }
365 }
366 // https://w3c.github.io/webrtc-stats/#dom-rtcsentrtpstreamstats-bytessent
367 int64_t payload_bytes_sent = 0;
368 // https://w3c.github.io/webrtc-stats/#dom-rtcoutboundrtpstreamstats-headerbytessent
369 int64_t header_and_padding_bytes_sent = 0;
370 // https://w3c.github.io/webrtc-stats/#dom-rtcoutboundrtpstreamstats-retransmittedbytessent
371 uint64_t retransmitted_bytes_sent = 0;
372 int packets_sent = 0;
373 // https://w3c.github.io/webrtc-stats/#dom-rtcoutboundrtpstreamstats-retransmittedpacketssent
374 uint64_t retransmitted_packets_sent = 0;
375 int packets_lost = 0;
376 float fraction_lost = 0.0f;
377 int64_t rtt_ms = 0;
378 std::string codec_name;
379 absl::optional<int> codec_payload_type;
380 std::vector<SsrcSenderInfo> local_stats;
381 std::vector<SsrcReceiverInfo> remote_stats;
382 // A snapshot of the most recent Report Block with additional data of interest
383 // to statistics. Used to implement RTCRemoteInboundRtpStreamStats. Within
384 // this list, the ReportBlockData::RTCPReportBlock::source_ssrc(), which is
385 // the SSRC of the corresponding outbound RTP stream, is unique.
386 std::vector<webrtc::ReportBlockData> report_block_datas;
387};
388
389struct MediaReceiverInfo {
390 MediaReceiverInfo();
391 ~MediaReceiverInfo();
392 void add_ssrc(const SsrcReceiverInfo& stat) { local_stats.push_back(stat); }
393 // Temporary utility function for call sites that only provide SSRC.
394 // As more info is added into SsrcSenderInfo, this function should go away.
395 void add_ssrc(uint32_t ssrc) {
396 SsrcReceiverInfo stat;
397 stat.ssrc = ssrc;
398 add_ssrc(stat);
399 }
400 std::vector<uint32_t> ssrcs() const {
401 std::vector<uint32_t> retval;
402 for (std::vector<SsrcReceiverInfo>::const_iterator it = local_stats.begin();
403 it != local_stats.end(); ++it) {
404 retval.push_back(it->ssrc);
405 }
406 return retval;
407 }
408 // Returns true if the media has been connected.
409 bool connected() const { return local_stats.size() > 0; }
410 // Utility accessor for clients that make the assumption only one ssrc
411 // exists per media.
412 // This will eventually go away.
413 // Call sites that compare this to zero should use connected();
414 // https://bugs.webrtc.org/8694
415 uint32_t ssrc() const {
416 if (connected()) {
417 return local_stats[0].ssrc;
418 } else {
419 return 0;
420 }
421 }
422
423 // https://w3c.github.io/webrtc-stats/#dom-rtcinboundrtpstreamstats-bytesreceived
424 int64_t payload_bytes_rcvd = 0;
425 // https://w3c.github.io/webrtc-stats/#dom-rtcinboundrtpstreamstats-headerbytesreceived
426 int64_t header_and_padding_bytes_rcvd = 0;
427 int packets_rcvd = 0;
428 int packets_lost = 0;
429 // The timestamp at which the last packet was received, i.e. the time of the
430 // local clock when it was received - not the RTP timestamp of that packet.
431 // https://w3c.github.io/webrtc-stats/#dom-rtcinboundrtpstreamstats-lastpacketreceivedtimestamp
432 absl::optional<int64_t> last_packet_received_timestamp_ms;
433 // https://w3c.github.io/webrtc-stats/#dom-rtcinboundrtpstreamstats-estimatedplayouttimestamp
434 absl::optional<int64_t> estimated_playout_ntp_timestamp_ms;
435 std::string codec_name;
436 absl::optional<int> codec_payload_type;
437 std::vector<SsrcReceiverInfo> local_stats;
438 std::vector<SsrcSenderInfo> remote_stats;
439};
440
441struct VoiceSenderInfo : public MediaSenderInfo {
442 VoiceSenderInfo();
443 ~VoiceSenderInfo();
444 int jitter_ms = 0;
445 // Current audio level, expressed linearly [0,32767].
446 int audio_level = 0;
447 // See description of "totalAudioEnergy" in the WebRTC stats spec:
448 // https://w3c.github.io/webrtc-stats/#dom-rtcmediastreamtrackstats-totalaudioenergy
449 double total_input_energy = 0.0;
450 double total_input_duration = 0.0;
451 bool typing_noise_detected = false;
452 webrtc::ANAStats ana_statistics;
453 webrtc::AudioProcessingStats apm_statistics;
454};
455
456struct VoiceReceiverInfo : public MediaReceiverInfo {
457 VoiceReceiverInfo();
458 ~VoiceReceiverInfo();
459 int jitter_ms = 0;
460 int jitter_buffer_ms = 0;
461 int jitter_buffer_preferred_ms = 0;
462 int delay_estimate_ms = 0;
463 int audio_level = 0;
464 // Stats below correspond to similarly-named fields in the WebRTC stats spec.
465 // https://w3c.github.io/webrtc-stats/#dom-rtcmediastreamtrackstats
466 double total_output_energy = 0.0;
467 uint64_t total_samples_received = 0;
468 double total_output_duration = 0.0;
469 uint64_t concealed_samples = 0;
470 uint64_t silent_concealed_samples = 0;
471 uint64_t concealment_events = 0;
472 double jitter_buffer_delay_seconds = 0.0;
473 uint64_t jitter_buffer_emitted_count = 0;
474 double jitter_buffer_target_delay_seconds = 0.0;
475 uint64_t inserted_samples_for_deceleration = 0;
476 uint64_t removed_samples_for_acceleration = 0;
477 uint64_t fec_packets_received = 0;
478 uint64_t fec_packets_discarded = 0;
479 // Stats below DO NOT correspond directly to anything in the WebRTC stats
480 // fraction of synthesized audio inserted through expansion.
481 float expand_rate = 0.0f;
482 // fraction of synthesized speech inserted through expansion.
483 float speech_expand_rate = 0.0f;
484 // fraction of data out of secondary decoding, including FEC and RED.
485 float secondary_decoded_rate = 0.0f;
486 // Fraction of secondary data, including FEC and RED, that is discarded.
487 // Discarding of secondary data can be caused by the reception of the primary
488 // data, obsoleting the secondary data. It can also be caused by early
489 // or late arrival of secondary data. This metric is the percentage of
490 // discarded secondary data since last query of receiver info.
491 float secondary_discarded_rate = 0.0f;
492 // Fraction of data removed through time compression.
493 float accelerate_rate = 0.0f;
494 // Fraction of data inserted through time stretching.
495 float preemptive_expand_rate = 0.0f;
496 int decoding_calls_to_silence_generator = 0;
497 int decoding_calls_to_neteq = 0;
498 int decoding_normal = 0;
499 // TODO(alexnarest): Consider decoding_neteq_plc for consistency
500 int decoding_plc = 0;
501 int decoding_codec_plc = 0;
502 int decoding_cng = 0;
503 int decoding_plc_cng = 0;
504 int decoding_muted_output = 0;
505 // Estimated capture start time in NTP time in ms.
506 int64_t capture_start_ntp_time_ms = -1;
507 // Count of the number of buffer flushes.
508 uint64_t jitter_buffer_flushes = 0;
509 // Number of samples expanded due to delayed packets.
510 uint64_t delayed_packet_outage_samples = 0;
511 // Arrival delay of received audio packets.
512 double relative_packet_arrival_delay_seconds = 0.0;
513 // Count and total duration of audio interruptions (loss-concealement periods
514 // longer than 150 ms).
515 int32_t interruption_count = 0;
516 int32_t total_interruption_duration_ms = 0;
517 // Remote outbound stats derived by the received RTCP sender reports.
518 // https://w3c.github.io/webrtc-stats/#remoteoutboundrtpstats-dict*
519 absl::optional<int64_t> last_sender_report_timestamp_ms;
520 absl::optional<int64_t> last_sender_report_remote_timestamp_ms;
521 uint32_t sender_reports_packets_sent = 0;
522 uint64_t sender_reports_bytes_sent = 0;
523 uint64_t sender_reports_reports_count = 0;
524};
525
526struct VideoSenderInfo : public MediaSenderInfo {
527 VideoSenderInfo();
528 ~VideoSenderInfo();
529 std::vector<SsrcGroup> ssrc_groups;
530 std::string encoder_implementation_name;
531 int firs_rcvd = 0;
532 int plis_rcvd = 0;
533 int nacks_rcvd = 0;
534 int send_frame_width = 0;
535 int send_frame_height = 0;
536 int frames = 0;
537 int framerate_input = 0;
538 int framerate_sent = 0;
539 int aggregated_framerate_sent = 0;
540 int nominal_bitrate = 0;
541 int adapt_reason = 0;
542 int adapt_changes = 0;
543 // https://w3c.github.io/webrtc-stats/#dom-rtcoutboundrtpstreamstats-qualitylimitationreason
544 webrtc::QualityLimitationReason quality_limitation_reason =
545 webrtc::QualityLimitationReason::kNone;
546 // https://w3c.github.io/webrtc-stats/#dom-rtcoutboundrtpstreamstats-qualitylimitationdurations
547 std::map<webrtc::QualityLimitationReason, int64_t>
548 quality_limitation_durations_ms;
549 // https://w3c.github.io/webrtc-stats/#dom-rtcoutboundrtpstreamstats-qualitylimitationresolutionchanges
550 uint32_t quality_limitation_resolution_changes = 0;
551 int avg_encode_ms = 0;
552 int encode_usage_percent = 0;
553 uint32_t frames_encoded = 0;
554 uint32_t key_frames_encoded = 0;
555 // https://w3c.github.io/webrtc-stats/#dom-rtcoutboundrtpstreamstats-totalencodetime
556 uint64_t total_encode_time_ms = 0;
557 // https://w3c.github.io/webrtc-stats/#dom-rtcoutboundrtpstreamstats-totalencodedbytestarget
558 uint64_t total_encoded_bytes_target = 0;
559 uint64_t total_packet_send_delay_ms = 0;
560 bool has_entered_low_resolution = false;
561 absl::optional<uint64_t> qp_sum;
562 webrtc::VideoContentType content_type = webrtc::VideoContentType::UNSPECIFIED;
563 uint32_t frames_sent = 0;
564 // https://w3c.github.io/webrtc-stats/#dom-rtcvideosenderstats-hugeframessent
565 uint32_t huge_frames_sent = 0;
566 uint32_t aggregated_huge_frames_sent = 0;
567 absl::optional<std::string> rid;
568};
569
570struct VideoReceiverInfo : public MediaReceiverInfo {
571 VideoReceiverInfo();
572 ~VideoReceiverInfo();
573 std::vector<SsrcGroup> ssrc_groups;
574 std::string decoder_implementation_name;
575 int packets_concealed = 0;
576 int firs_sent = 0;
577 int plis_sent = 0;
578 int nacks_sent = 0;
579 int frame_width = 0;
580 int frame_height = 0;
581 int framerate_rcvd = 0;
582 int framerate_decoded = 0;
583 int framerate_output = 0;
584 // Framerate as sent to the renderer.
585 int framerate_render_input = 0;
586 // Framerate that the renderer reports.
587 int framerate_render_output = 0;
588 uint32_t frames_received = 0;
589 uint32_t frames_dropped = 0;
590 uint32_t frames_decoded = 0;
591 uint32_t key_frames_decoded = 0;
592 uint32_t frames_rendered = 0;
593 absl::optional<uint64_t> qp_sum;
594 // https://w3c.github.io/webrtc-stats/#dom-rtcinboundrtpstreamstats-totaldecodetime
595 uint64_t total_decode_time_ms = 0;
596 double total_inter_frame_delay = 0;
597 double total_squared_inter_frame_delay = 0;
598 int64_t interframe_delay_max_ms = -1;
599 uint32_t freeze_count = 0;
600 uint32_t pause_count = 0;
601 uint32_t total_freezes_duration_ms = 0;
602 uint32_t total_pauses_duration_ms = 0;
603 uint32_t total_frames_duration_ms = 0;
604 double sum_squared_frame_durations = 0.0;
605 uint32_t jitter_ms = 0;
606
607 webrtc::VideoContentType content_type = webrtc::VideoContentType::UNSPECIFIED;
608
609 // All stats below are gathered per-VideoReceiver, but some will be correlated
610 // across MediaStreamTracks. NOTE(hta): when sinking stats into per-SSRC
611 // structures, reflect this in the new layout.
612
613 // Current frame decode latency.
614 int decode_ms = 0;
615 // Maximum observed frame decode latency.
616 int max_decode_ms = 0;
617 // Jitter (network-related) latency.
618 int jitter_buffer_ms = 0;
619 // Jitter (network-related) latency (cumulative).
620 // https://w3c.github.io/webrtc-stats/#dom-rtcvideoreceiverstats-jitterbufferdelay
621 double jitter_buffer_delay_seconds = 0;
622 // Number of observations for cumulative jitter latency.
623 // https://w3c.github.io/webrtc-stats/#dom-rtcvideoreceiverstats-jitterbufferemittedcount
624 uint64_t jitter_buffer_emitted_count = 0;
625 // Requested minimum playout latency.
626 int min_playout_delay_ms = 0;
627 // Requested latency to account for rendering delay.
628 int render_delay_ms = 0;
629 // Target overall delay: network+decode+render, accounting for
630 // min_playout_delay_ms.
631 int target_delay_ms = 0;
632 // Current overall delay, possibly ramping towards target_delay_ms.
633 int current_delay_ms = 0;
634
635 // Estimated capture start time in NTP time in ms.
636 int64_t capture_start_ntp_time_ms = -1;
637
638 // First frame received to first frame decoded latency.
639 int64_t first_frame_received_to_decoded_ms = -1;
640
641 // Timing frame info: all important timestamps for a full lifetime of a
642 // single 'timing frame'.
643 absl::optional<webrtc::TimingFrameInfo> timing_frame_info;
644};
645
646struct BandwidthEstimationInfo {
647 int available_send_bandwidth = 0;
648 int available_recv_bandwidth = 0;
649 int target_enc_bitrate = 0;
650 int actual_enc_bitrate = 0;
651 int retransmit_bitrate = 0;
652 int transmit_bitrate = 0;
653 int64_t bucket_delay = 0;
654};
655
656// Maps from payload type to |RtpCodecParameters|.
657typedef std::map<int, webrtc::RtpCodecParameters> RtpCodecParametersMap;
658
659struct VoiceMediaInfo {
660 VoiceMediaInfo();
661 ~VoiceMediaInfo();
662 void Clear() {
663 senders.clear();
664 receivers.clear();
665 send_codecs.clear();
666 receive_codecs.clear();
667 }
668 std::vector<VoiceSenderInfo> senders;
669 std::vector<VoiceReceiverInfo> receivers;
670 RtpCodecParametersMap send_codecs;
671 RtpCodecParametersMap receive_codecs;
672 int32_t device_underrun_count = 0;
673};
674
675struct VideoMediaInfo {
676 VideoMediaInfo();
677 ~VideoMediaInfo();
678 void Clear() {
679 senders.clear();
680 aggregated_senders.clear();
681 receivers.clear();
682 send_codecs.clear();
683 receive_codecs.clear();
684 }
685 // Each sender info represents one "outbound-rtp" stream.In non - simulcast,
686 // this means one info per RtpSender but if simulcast is used this means
687 // one info per simulcast layer.
688 std::vector<VideoSenderInfo> senders;
689 // Used for legacy getStats() API's "ssrc" stats and modern getStats() API's
690 // "track" stats. If simulcast is used, instead of having one sender info per
691 // simulcast layer, the metrics of all layers of an RtpSender are aggregated
692 // into a single sender info per RtpSender.
693 std::vector<VideoSenderInfo> aggregated_senders;
694 std::vector<VideoReceiverInfo> receivers;
695 RtpCodecParametersMap send_codecs;
696 RtpCodecParametersMap receive_codecs;
697};
698
699struct RtcpParameters {
700 bool reduced_size = false;
701 bool remote_estimate = false;
702};
703
704template <class Codec>
705struct RtpParameters {
706 virtual ~RtpParameters() = default;
707
708 std::vector<Codec> codecs;
709 std::vector<webrtc::RtpExtension> extensions;
710 // For a send stream this is true if we've neogtiated a send direction,
711 // for a receive stream this is true if we've negotiated a receive direction.
712 bool is_stream_active = true;
713
714 // TODO(pthatcher): Add streams.
715 RtcpParameters rtcp;
716
717 std::string ToString() const {
718 rtc::StringBuilder ost;
719 ost << "{";
720 const char* separator = "";
721 for (const auto& entry : ToStringMap()) {
722 ost << separator << entry.first << ": " << entry.second;
723 separator = ", ";
724 }
725 ost << "}";
726 return ost.Release();
727 }
728
729 protected:
730 virtual std::map<std::string, std::string> ToStringMap() const {
731 return {{"codecs", VectorToString(codecs)},
732 {"extensions", VectorToString(extensions)}};
733 }
734};
735
736// TODO(deadbeef): Rename to RtpSenderParameters, since they're intended to
737// encapsulate all the parameters needed for an RtpSender.
738template <class Codec>
739struct RtpSendParameters : RtpParameters<Codec> {
740 int max_bandwidth_bps = -1;
741 // This is the value to be sent in the MID RTP header extension (if the header
742 // extension in included in the list of extensions).
743 std::string mid;
744 bool extmap_allow_mixed = false;
745
746 protected:
747 std::map<std::string, std::string> ToStringMap() const override {
748 auto params = RtpParameters<Codec>::ToStringMap();
749 params["max_bandwidth_bps"] = rtc::ToString(max_bandwidth_bps);
750 params["mid"] = (mid.empty() ? "<not set>" : mid);
751 params["extmap-allow-mixed"] = extmap_allow_mixed ? "true" : "false";
752 return params;
753 }
754};
755
756struct AudioSendParameters : RtpSendParameters<AudioCodec> {
757 AudioSendParameters();
758 ~AudioSendParameters() override;
759 AudioOptions options;
760
761 protected:
762 std::map<std::string, std::string> ToStringMap() const override;
763};
764
765struct AudioRecvParameters : RtpParameters<AudioCodec> {};
766
767class VoiceMediaChannel : public MediaChannel, public Delayable {
768 public:
769 explicit VoiceMediaChannel(webrtc::TaskQueueBase* network_thread)
770 : MediaChannel(network_thread) {}
771 VoiceMediaChannel(const MediaConfig& config,
772 webrtc::TaskQueueBase* network_thread)
773 : MediaChannel(config, network_thread) {}
774 ~VoiceMediaChannel() override {}
775
776 cricket::MediaType media_type() const override;
777 virtual bool SetSendParameters(const AudioSendParameters& params) = 0;
778 virtual bool SetRecvParameters(const AudioRecvParameters& params) = 0;
779 // Get the receive parameters for the incoming stream identified by |ssrc|.
780 virtual webrtc::RtpParameters GetRtpReceiveParameters(
781 uint32_t ssrc) const = 0;
782 // Retrieve the receive parameters for the default receive
783 // stream, which is used when SSRCs are not signaled.
784 virtual webrtc::RtpParameters GetDefaultRtpReceiveParameters() const = 0;
785 // Starts or stops playout of received audio.
786 virtual void SetPlayout(bool playout) = 0;
787 // Starts or stops sending (and potentially capture) of local audio.
788 virtual void SetSend(bool send) = 0;
789 // Configure stream for sending.
790 virtual bool SetAudioSend(uint32_t ssrc,
791 bool enable,
792 const AudioOptions* options,
793 AudioSource* source) = 0;
794 // Set speaker output volume of the specified ssrc.
795 virtual bool SetOutputVolume(uint32_t ssrc, double volume) = 0;
796 // Set speaker output volume for future unsignaled streams.
797 virtual bool SetDefaultOutputVolume(double volume) = 0;
798 // Returns if the telephone-event has been negotiated.
799 virtual bool CanInsertDtmf() = 0;
800 // Send a DTMF |event|. The DTMF out-of-band signal will be used.
801 // The |ssrc| should be either 0 or a valid send stream ssrc.
802 // The valid value for the |event| are 0 to 15 which corresponding to
803 // DTMF event 0-9, *, #, A-D.
804 virtual bool InsertDtmf(uint32_t ssrc, int event, int duration) = 0;
805 // Gets quality stats for the channel.
806 virtual bool GetStats(VoiceMediaInfo* info,
807 bool get_and_clear_legacy_stats) = 0;
808
809 virtual void SetRawAudioSink(
810 uint32_t ssrc,
811 std::unique_ptr<webrtc::AudioSinkInterface> sink) = 0;
812 virtual void SetDefaultRawAudioSink(
813 std::unique_ptr<webrtc::AudioSinkInterface> sink) = 0;
814
815 virtual std::vector<webrtc::RtpSource> GetSources(uint32_t ssrc) const = 0;
816};
817
818// TODO(deadbeef): Rename to VideoSenderParameters, since they're intended to
819// encapsulate all the parameters needed for a video RtpSender.
820struct VideoSendParameters : RtpSendParameters<VideoCodec> {
821 VideoSendParameters();
822 ~VideoSendParameters() override;
823 // Use conference mode? This flag comes from the remote
824 // description's SDP line 'a=x-google-flag:conference', copied over
825 // by VideoChannel::SetRemoteContent_w, and ultimately used by
826 // conference mode screencast logic in
827 // WebRtcVideoChannel::WebRtcVideoSendStream::CreateVideoEncoderConfig.
828 // The special screencast behaviour is disabled by default.
829 bool conference_mode = false;
830
831 protected:
832 std::map<std::string, std::string> ToStringMap() const override;
833};
834
835// TODO(deadbeef): Rename to VideoReceiverParameters, since they're intended to
836// encapsulate all the parameters needed for a video RtpReceiver.
837struct VideoRecvParameters : RtpParameters<VideoCodec> {};
838
839class VideoMediaChannel : public MediaChannel, public Delayable {
840 public:
841 explicit VideoMediaChannel(webrtc::TaskQueueBase* network_thread)
842 : MediaChannel(network_thread) {}
843 VideoMediaChannel(const MediaConfig& config,
844 webrtc::TaskQueueBase* network_thread)
845 : MediaChannel(config, network_thread) {}
846 ~VideoMediaChannel() override {}
847
848 cricket::MediaType media_type() const override;
849 virtual bool SetSendParameters(const VideoSendParameters& params) = 0;
850 virtual bool SetRecvParameters(const VideoRecvParameters& params) = 0;
851 // Get the receive parameters for the incoming stream identified by |ssrc|.
852 virtual webrtc::RtpParameters GetRtpReceiveParameters(
853 uint32_t ssrc) const = 0;
854 // Retrieve the receive parameters for the default receive
855 // stream, which is used when SSRCs are not signaled.
856 virtual webrtc::RtpParameters GetDefaultRtpReceiveParameters() const = 0;
857 // Gets the currently set codecs/payload types to be used for outgoing media.
858 virtual bool GetSendCodec(VideoCodec* send_codec) = 0;
859 // Starts or stops transmission (and potentially capture) of local video.
860 virtual bool SetSend(bool send) = 0;
861 // Configure stream for sending and register a source.
862 // The |ssrc| must correspond to a registered send stream.
863 virtual bool SetVideoSend(
864 uint32_t ssrc,
865 const VideoOptions* options,
866 rtc::VideoSourceInterface<webrtc::VideoFrame>* source) = 0;
867 // Sets the sink object to be used for the specified stream.
868 virtual bool SetSink(uint32_t ssrc,
869 rtc::VideoSinkInterface<webrtc::VideoFrame>* sink) = 0;
870 // The sink is used for the 'default' stream.
871 virtual void SetDefaultSink(
872 rtc::VideoSinkInterface<webrtc::VideoFrame>* sink) = 0;
873 // This fills the "bitrate parts" (rtx, video bitrate) of the
874 // BandwidthEstimationInfo, since that part that isn't possible to get
875 // through webrtc::Call::GetStats, as they are statistics of the send
876 // streams.
877 // TODO(holmer): We should change this so that either BWE graphs doesn't
878 // need access to bitrates of the streams, or change the (RTC)StatsCollector
879 // so that it's getting the send stream stats separately by calling
880 // GetStats(), and merges with BandwidthEstimationInfo by itself.
881 virtual void FillBitrateInfo(BandwidthEstimationInfo* bwe_info) = 0;
882 // Gets quality stats for the channel.
883 virtual bool GetStats(VideoMediaInfo* info) = 0;
884 // Set recordable encoded frame callback for |ssrc|
885 virtual void SetRecordableEncodedFrameCallback(
886 uint32_t ssrc,
887 std::function<void(const webrtc::RecordableEncodedFrame&)> callback) = 0;
888 // Clear recordable encoded frame callback for |ssrc|
889 virtual void ClearRecordableEncodedFrameCallback(uint32_t ssrc) = 0;
890 // Cause generation of a keyframe for |ssrc|
891 virtual void GenerateKeyFrame(uint32_t ssrc) = 0;
892
893 virtual std::vector<webrtc::RtpSource> GetSources(uint32_t ssrc) const = 0;
894};
895
896// Info about data received in DataMediaChannel. For use in
897// DataMediaChannel::SignalDataReceived and in all of the signals that
898// signal fires, on up the chain.
899struct ReceiveDataParams {
900 // The in-packet stream indentifier.
901 // SCTP data channels use SIDs.
902 int sid = 0;
903 // The type of message (binary, text, or control).
904 webrtc::DataMessageType type = webrtc::DataMessageType::kText;
905 // A per-stream value incremented per packet in the stream.
906 int seq_num = 0;
907};
908
909enum SendDataResult { SDR_SUCCESS, SDR_ERROR, SDR_BLOCK };
